Package com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.sort.helper

Class BaseHelper<X>

java.lang.Object
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.sort.helper.BaseHelper<X>
Type Parameters:
X - the type of elements managed by this helper.
Direct Known Subclasses:
BaseComparableHelper, BaseComparatorHelper
public abstract class BaseHelper<X> extends Object
The BaseHelper abstract class provides utility methods and configuration options for managing and instrumenting operations related to a collection of elements of type X. It is designed to track various performance metrics such as comparisons, swaps, and other operations through instrumentation. Subclasses are expected to implement specific behavior.

  • Field Details

    • instrumenter

      public final Instrument instrumenter
      An instrument instance used for capturing and recording performance metrics of various operations during the execution of algorithms or processes.

      The instrumenter can track metrics such as swaps, comparisons, copies, hits, lookups, fixes, and inversions. It provides statistical analysis and is primarily used for performance measurement and optimization.

      This object is designed to integrate with the BaseHelper class to enable or disable instrumentation dynamically and collect relevant statistical data for analyzing algorithm behavior.

    • description

      protected final String description
      A brief, human-readable textual description of this helper instance. Primarily used to describe the purpose or characteristics of the helper object.

    • random

      protected final Random random
      A randomly initialized Random instance used for generating random values. This variable is declared final to ensure that each instance of the helper class gets a distinct but constant random number generator throughout its lifecycle. It is used by methods for generating randomized input or performing operations that require randomization.

    • config

      protected final Config config
      A configuration object containing settings and parameters required for the operation of this helper instance. The configuration is immutable and ensures consistent settings during the execution of the program.

    • cutoff

      protected final int cutoff
      The cutoff value used to determine a threshold within the helper operations. This threshold may influence decision-making processes such as when to switch between different algorithms, techniques, or strategies during execution. It is intended to be configured to optimize performance based on the specific use case.

    • randomArray

      protected X[] randomArray
      Keep track of the random array that was generated. This is available via the InstrumentedHelper class.

    • n

      protected int n

    • INSTRUMENT

      public static final String INSTRUMENT
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • BaseHelper

      public BaseHelper(String description, Random random, Instrument instrumenter, Config config, int n)
      Constructor for the BaseHelper class.
      Parameters:
      description - a short textual description of this helper instance
      random - an instance of Random for generating random numbers
      instrumenter - an Instrument instance for capturing performance metrics
      config - a configuration object containing settings such as cutoff values
      n - an integer representing the size to be managed

  • Method Details

    • instrumented

      public abstract boolean instrumented()
      Determines if instrumentation is enabled for this helper.
      Returns:
      true if instrumentation is enabled, false otherwise.

    • getDescription

      public String getDescription()
      Retrieves the description associated with the helper instance.
      Returns:
      a string containing the description of the helper.

    • getConfig

      public Config getConfig()
      Retrieves the configuration object associated with this helper instance.
      Returns:
      the configuration object of type Config.

    • init

      public void init(int n)
      Parameters:
      n - the size to be managed.
      Throws:
      HelperException - if n is inconsistent.

    • init

      public void init(int n, int nRuns)
      Initializes the helper instance with a specified size and number of runs. Delegates the initialization process to the associated instrumenter.
      Parameters:
      n - the size to be managed by the helper
      nRuns - the number of runs for initialization

    • getN

      public int getN()
      Retrieves the value of the variable 'n'.
      Returns:
      the integer value of the field 'n'.

    • cutoff

      public int cutoff()
      Get the configured cutoff value.
      Returns:
      a value for cutoff.

    • close

      public void close()
      Closes and performs necessary cleanup for this helper instance. Typically used to release any resources or finalize any operations associated with the helper. The exact behavior depends on the implementation details of the containing class and its fields.

    • random

      public X[] random(int m, Class<X> clazz, Function<Random,X> f)
      Generates an array of random elements of type X using a specified function and class type.
      Parameters:
      m - the number of random elements to generate. Must be greater than 0.
      clazz - the class type of the elements to generate.
      f - a function that accepts a Random object and generates an instance of type X.
      Returns:
      an array of type X filled with randomly generated elements.
      Throws:
      HelperException - if the requested number of elements (m) is less than or equal to 0.

    • getStatPack

      public StatPack getStatPack()
      Retrieves the StatPack instance containing various collected statistical data.
      Returns:
      a StatPack object providing access to statistical metrics such as swaps, comparisons, copies, and other tracked operations.

    • getCompares

      public long getCompares()
      Retrieves the total number of comparison operations performed. This method delegates the request to the associated instrumenter.
      Returns:
      the total count of comparison operations as a long value

    • getSwaps

      public long getSwaps()
      Retrieves the total number of swap operations recorded by the instrumenter.
      Returns:
      the total count of swaps as a long value.

    • getFixes

      public long getFixes()
      Retrieves the total number of "fixes" performed by the associated instrumenter.

      A "fix" generally refers to a corrective operation tracked during algorithm execution.

      Returns:
      the total count of fixes as a long value.

    • incrementCopies

      public void incrementCopies(int n)
      Increments the copy count by delegating to the instrumenter.
      Parameters:
      n - the number of copies to increment

    • incrementHits

      public void incrementHits(long n)
      Increments the hit count by delegating to the associated instrumenter. This method is used to track the number of "hits" recorded during the execution of an algorithm or process, which aids in performance measurement and analysis.
      Parameters:
      n - the number by which to increase the hit count

    • incrementLookups

      public void incrementLookups()
      Increments the count of lookups performed by delegating to the associated instrumenter. This method is used to track the number of lookup operations for analysis and performance measurement purposes.

    • incrementFixes

      public void incrementFixes(int n)
      If instrumenting, increment the number of fixes by n.
      Parameters:
      n - the number of copies made.

    • incrementCompares

      public void incrementCompares()
      Increments the comparison count by delegating to the associated instrumenter. This method is used to track the number of comparison operations performed during the execution of an algorithm or process, facilitating performance measurement and analysis.

    • incrementSwaps

      public void incrementSwaps(int n)
      Increments the swap count by the specified value using the instrumenter.
      Parameters:
      n - the number of swaps to increment

    • getHits

      public long getHits()
      Retrieves the total number of "hits" recorded by the instrumenter.
      Returns:
      the total number of hits as a long value

    • getLookups

      public long getLookups()
      Retrieves the total number of lookup operations performed.
      Returns:
      the total count of lookups as a long value

    • getCopies

      public long getCopies()
      Retrieves the number of copies performed by the instrumenter associated with this helper.
      Returns:
      the total number of copies as a long value.

    • countFixes

      public boolean countFixes()
      Determines whether the system should count the number of fixes during its operation.
      Returns:
      true if counting fixes is enabled, otherwise false

    • gatherStatistic

      public void gatherStatistic()
      Collects and records statistical data related to various operations such as swaps, comparisons, copies, inversions, fixes, hits, and lookups. This method delegates the task of gathering statistics to the instrumenter associated with this helper instance.

    • isShowStats

      public boolean isShowStats()
      Determines if statistics display is enabled for this helper.
      Returns:
      true if statistics are enabled to be shown; false otherwise.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
